results.title: Judy & Punch reference images from Edie Kurzer's studio
results.brief_description: Edie Kurzer often explores mood and atmosphere with images instead of using them as direct influences. While she may use sketches to work through details, she gains more inspiration from objects like feathers, buttons or fabrics.

results.title: Judy & Punch costume sketches
results.credit_line: Courtesy Vice Media LLC, Blue-Tongue Films and Pariah Productions
results.brief_description: Edie Kurzer often explores mood and atmosphere with images instead of using them as direct influences. While she may use sketches to work through details, she gains more inspiration from objects like feathers, buttons or fabrics.
results.description: Judy & Punch costume designer Edie Kurzer often explores mood and atmosphere with images instead of using them as direct influences. While she may use sketches to work through details, she gains more inspiration from objects like feathers, buttons or fabrics, and then works with a fabric cutter who sketches how the costume should be cut and assembled.
description_for_label: Judy & Punch costume designer Edie Kurzer often explores mood and atmosphere with images instead of using them as direct influences. While she may use sketches to work through details, she gains more inspiration from objects like feathers, buttons or fabrics, and then works with a fabric cutter who sketches how the costume should be cut and assembled.

results.title: Judy & Punch
results.brief_description: In the anarchic town of Seaside, nowhere near the sea, puppeteers Judy and Punch are trying to resurrect their marionette show. The show is a hit due to Judy’s superior puppeteering but Punch’s driving ambition and penchant for whisky lead to a inevitable tragedy that Judy must avenge.

constellations_other.name: True blue, true crime
constellations_other.description: Robert Connolly's The Dry is a recent Australian crime blockbuster, but the writer, director and producer's first film (and first crime film) connects to a longstanding tradition of true-blue crime stories from some of our greatest filmmakers.

constellations_other.name: The Australian industry
constellations_other.description: Though our local industry is small, our impact is huge!

constellations_other.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

results.description: In the anarchic town of Seaside, nowhere near the sea, puppeteers Judy and Punch are trying to resurrect their marionette show. The show is a hit due to Judy’s superior puppeteering but Punch’s driving ambition and penchant for whisky lead to a inevitable tragedy that Judy must avenge.

results.title: Judoka
results.creator_credit: Josef Reeve, Bernard Devlin, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The unusual story of a young Canadian athlete, Doug Rogers, who developed, in Japan, a talent for judo that led him into competition for the world championship at the Tokyo Olympics and subsequent competition at the Pan-American Games. The film shows the intensive judo training Rogers took at a Tokyo college, as well as glimpses of his life in Japan.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Josef Reeve, Bernard Devlin, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
